p: Nepeta L. (tribe Mentheae: subtribe Nepetoideae), is one of the largest genera in the Lamiaceae family. It represents more than 280 species, displaying a significant diversity in growth forms, pollination biology, floral morphology, and secondary metabolites [ 1] Nepeta is represented in the flora of Iran by 79 species, 42 of which, such as Nepeta asterotricha Rech. f., are endemic [ 2, 3].
